meanings.definition: To break or cause to break
meanings.sent1: She accidentally fract the vase while dusting.
meanings.sent2: The hammer can easily fract the glass if not handled carefully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to fract the toy bone into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent4: His loud shout seemed to fract the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake's force was strong enough to fract the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: A break or crack in a hard object
meanings.sent1: The earthquake caused a large fract in the wall of the building.
meanings.sent2: The car accident resulted in a significant fract on the windshield.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended the fract in the sidewalk was a secret tunnel.
meanings.sent4: The fract in the mirror reflected a distorted image of her face.
meanings.sent5: The hiker carefully avoided stepping on the fract in the rocky path.

meanings.definition: A fraction or fragment of something
meanings.sent1: She only ate a small fract of the cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The artist used every fract of color on the palette to create the masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a tiny fract of evidence that led to the suspect.
meanings.sent4: His memory held onto every fract of the conversation they had that day.
meanings.sent5: The old book was missing a fract of its pages, making it incomplete.
